headline: Several States Sue to Stop Biden's Ending of Title 42
sentences: They cite "increased health care costs for aliens infected with COVID-19 and the cost of increased illegal immigration caused by the Termination Order, and the presence of much greater numbers of paroled aliens with non-meritorious asylum claims who were induced to enter the United States because of the Termination Order."

"After considering current public health conditions and an increased availability of tools to fight COVID-19 (such as highly effective vaccines and therapeutics), the CDC Director has determined that an Order suspending the right to introduce migrants into the United States is no longer necessary," said the CDC.

Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich said Monday morning on "FOX & Friends:"
We want to stop the Biden administration from rescinding Title 42 because it may be one of the most boneheaded decisions of this administration, and they have done a lot of dumb things.

The states' lawsuit read, "This suit challenges an imminent, man-made, self-inflicted calamity: the abrupt elimination of the only safety valve preventing this administration's disastrous border policies from devolving into an unmitigated catastrophe."

To try to alleviate this additional surge, DHS Secretary Mayorkas claimed that the DHS has "put in place a comprehensive, whole-of-government strategy to manage any potential increase in the number of migrants encountered at our border."

The States' lawsuit argues that the removal of Title 42 endangers the citizens of their states and breaks the 'notice-and-comment' requirements set forth by the Administrative Procedure Act, and is thus "arbitrary and capricious."
The Attorneys General of Arizona, Louisiana, and Missouri stated that the policy's repeal was enacted unlawfully and will have a devastating impact on their communities.
Yet Republicans and many moderate Democrats have warned that lifting the order will undoubtedly lead to even more significant numbers of apprehensions at the border.
